text: Handball at the Islamic Solidarity Games was introduced for men at the first edition in 2005 Islamic Solidarity Games held in Mecca. Women's handball competition was introduced at the fourth edition of 2017 Islamic Solidarity Games held in Baku. ==Men== ===Summary=== {| border=1 style="border- collapse:collapse; font-size:100%; text-align:center;" cellpadding=3 cellspacing=0 |- !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !rowspan=2 width=15%|Host !width=1% rowspan=100 bgcolor=ffffff| !colspan=3|Gold medal game !width=1% rowspan=100 bgcolor=ffffff| !colspan=3|Bronze medal game |- bgcolor=#efefef !width=14% bgcolor=#ffd700|Gold Medalists !width=9%|Score !width=14% bgcolor=#c0c0c0|Silver Medalists !width=14% bgcolor=#cc9966|Bronze Medalists !width=9%|Score !width=14% bgcolor=#fffafa|4th place |- |2005 Details | Mecca |'''''' |25 – 23 | | |32 – 28 | |- |2010 | Tehran |colspan=3|Cancelled |colspan=3|Cancelled |- |2013 | Palembang |colspan=3|Not held |colspan=3|Not held |- |2017 Details | Baku |'''''' |26 – 21 | | |27 – 22 | |- |2021 | Istanbul |colspan=3|TBD |colspan=3|TBD |} ===Medal table=== ===Participating nations=== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" ! width=150|Team ! 2005 ! 2017 !!
